ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS

block.text: HEBREWS

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 1
God has, in the past, spoken to the fathers through the prophets at many times and in various ways.

block.text: Bipo long planti taim na long planti pasin God i bin givim tok long ol tumbuna bilong yumi long maus bilong ol profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He has at the end of these days spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the worlds.

block.text: Tasol long dispela taim nau, em long taim bilong las de, God i bin autim tok long yumi long maus bilong Pikinini Man bilong em. God i makim dispela Pikinini pinis bilong kisim olgeta samting, na long han bilong en God i bin mekim kamap dispela graun tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His Son is the radiance of his glory, the very image of his substance, and upholding all things by the word of his power. When he had by himself purged our sins, he sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high.

block.text: Dispela Pikinini em i soim bikpela lait bilong God na em i lait moa yet long yumi, na em i wankain tru olsem God yet. Tok bilong en i gat strong, na long dispela tok em i save mekim olgeta samting i stap strong. Em i pinisim wok bilong en bilong lusim ol sin na mekim ol manmeri i kamap klin, orait em i sindaun long han sut bilong Namba Wan King i stap antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of God was made so much better than the angels, as he has inherited a more excellent name than they have.

block.text: Papa i givim nem long Pikinini bilong en, na dispela nem i gutpela tru na i winim tru nem bilong ol ensel. Olsem tasol em i mekim Pikinini i kamap Bikpela bilong ol ensel, na ol i aninit long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For to which of the angels did he say at any time,

block.text: Bipo God i bin tokim Pikinini bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my Son. Today I have become your father.”

block.text: "Yu pikinini bilong mi. Nau mi kamap papa bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and again,

block.text: Na em i bin tok gen olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will be to him a Father, and he will be to me a Son.”

block.text: "Bai mi stap papa bilong em, na em bai i stap pikinini bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, when he brings in the firstborn into the world he says,

block.text: Tasol wanem taim God i mekim dispela kain tok long wanpela ensel? Nogat tru.
Na taim em i bringim namba wan Pikinini bilong en i kam long graun, God I bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let all the angels of God worship him.”

block.text: "Olgeta ensel bilong God i mas lotu long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Of the angels he says,

block.text: God i bin tingting long ol ensel na em i mekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who makes his angels winds, and his servants a flame of fire.”

block.text: "Em i save mekim ol ensel bilong en i kamap olsem win. Em i save mekim ol wokman bilong en i kamap olsem hatpela paia."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But of the Son he says,

block.text: Tasol em i tok long Pikinini olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your Kingdom.

block.text: "God, yu stap king oltaim oltaim. Yu save bosim ol manmeri bilong yu long stretpela pasin tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.”

block.text: Yu save laikim stretpela pasin, na yu no laikim tru pasin nogut. Olsem na God bilong yu yet em i bin kapsaitim wel long yu, bilong makim yu olsem man i gat biknem. Na dispela i mekim yu i amamas moa yet. Ol poroman bilong yu ol i no inap amamas olsem yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And,

block.text: Na God i tokim Pikinini gen olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You, Lord, in the beginning, laid the foundation of the earth. The heavens are the works of your hands.

block.text: "Bikpela, bipo tru yu bin wokim dispela graun na em i stap strong. Na long han bilong yu yet yu bin wokim skai na olgeta samting antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will perish, but you continue. They all will grow old like a garment does.

block.text: Skai wantaim graun bai i bagarap olgeta, tasol yu save stap oltaim. Tupela bai i bagarap olsem laplap i olpela pinis na i bagarap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As a mantle, you will roll them up, and they will be changed; but you are the same. Your years will not fail.”

block.text: Bai yu raunim tupela olsem man i raunim mat. Bai yu senisim tupela olsem man i senisim klos. Tasol yu, yu save stap olsem tasol. Yu no save senis. Na taim bilong yu i no inap pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But which of the angels has he told at any time,

block.text: Bipo God i tokim Pikinini olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet?”

block.text: "Yu sindaun long han sut bilong mi inap mi putim ol birua bilong yu i stap aninit long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t they all serving spirits, sent out to do service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation?

block.text: Tasol wanem taim God i mekim dispela kain tok long wanpela ensel? Nogat tru.
Ol ensel ol i spirit, na ol i save mekim wok bilong God. God i save salim ol i go bilong helpim ol man em i laik kisim bek ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 2
Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard, lest perhaps we drift away.

block.text: Pikinini Bilong God i kisim biknem tru, olsem na dispela tok yumi harim pinis, yumi mas holim strong long tingting na bihainim gut. Nogut yumi slek long bihainim dispela tok na yumi lusim olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense;

block.text: Bipo God i bin givim tok long ol tumbuna bilong yumi long maus bilong ol ensel, na dispela tok i stap strong. Na olgeta man i kalapim na sakim dispela tok, ol i bin kisim pe nogut inap long pasin nogut ol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation? Salvation which at the first, having been spoken through the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard;

block.text: Tasol nau God i mekim wanpela wok bilong kisim bek yumi, na dispela wok bilong en em i bikpela samting tru. Olsem na sapos yumi givim baksait long dispela wok bilong God, olsem wanem na bai yumi ranawe na abrusim pe bilong sin? Bai yumi no inap tru. Pastaim Bikpela yet i bin autim tok long em i laik kisim bek yumi. Na ol man i harim tok bilong em, ol i bin tokim yumi olsem, "Dispela tok em i tru tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: God also testifying with them, both by signs and wonders, by various works of power, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to his own will?

block.text: Na God i mekim ol kain kain mirakel na olkain strongpela wok, na em i tilim ol presen bilong Holi Spirit long ol manmeri, inap long laik bilong em yet, na long dispela pasin em i soim olsem dispela tok bilong Pikinini bilong en, em i tru olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he didn’t subject the world to come, of which we speak, to angels.

block.text: Na sapos yumi tingting long nupela graun God bai i mekim kamap bihain, yumi save, God i no putim ol ensel bilong bosim dispela. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But one has somewhere testified, saying,

block.text: Long wanpela hap bilong buk bilong God wanpela man i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is man, that you think of him? Or the son of man, that you care for him?

block.text: "Mipela man i wanem samting, na yu save tingting long mipela? Mipela i samting nating. Bilong wanem yu save was gut long mipela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You made him a little lower than the angels. You crowned him with glory and honor; and did set him over the works of your hands.

block.text: Yu bin wokim mipela, na bilong sotpela taim tasol yu putim mipela i stap aninit long ol ensel. Yu bin litimapim mipela na givim namba na biknem long mipela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have put all things in subjection under his feet.”

block.text: Yu bin makim mipela bilong bosim olgeta samting yu bin wokim. Yu putim olgeta samting i stap aninit long mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in that he subjected all things to him, he left nothing that is not subject to him. But now we don’t see all things subjected to him, yet.

block.text: Dispela tok bilong God i putim olgeta samting i stap aninit long em, em i soim yumi olsem, em i no larim wanpela samting i stap nating na i no aninit long em. Tasol nau yumi no lukim yet olgeta samting i stap aninit long em. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we see him who has been made a little lower than the angels, Jesus. Because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that by the grace of God he should taste of death for everyone.

block.text: Tasol yumi lukim Jisas i kisim biknem tru. Bipo long sotpela taim tasol em i stap aninit long ol ensel, bai em i ken kisim ples bilong olgeta manmeri na i dai, na marimari bilong God i ken helpim olgeta manmeri. Jisas i karim bikpela pen na i dai, olsem na God i litimapim em na i givim bikpela namba na biknem long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things, in bringing many children to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

block.text: God em i as bilong olgeta samting, na em i bin wokim olgeta samting. Na em i laik bringim planti pikinini bilong en i go long heven na i stap gut tru. God i laik bai Jisas i mas kirapim wok bilong kisim bek ol manmeri, olsem na em i larim Jisas i karim pen, na long dispela pen em i mekim Jisas i kamap nambawan man tru bilong helpim ol manmeri. Dispela pasin God i mekim, em i stret tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For both he who sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all from one, for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers,
saying,

block.text: Yumia save, dispela man bilong mekim olgeta manmeri i kamap lain manmeri bilong God, na dispela ol manmeri em i bin mekim ol i kamap holi, olgeta i gat wanpela papa tasol. Olsem na em i save kolim ol "brata", na em i no sem long kolim ol olsem.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will declare your name to my brothers. In the midst of the congregation I will sing your praise.”

block.text: "Bai mi autim nem bilong yu long ol brata bilong mi. Taim ol i bung bilong lotu bai mi singim song bilong litimapim nem bilong yu namel long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: Na em i tok gen,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will put my trust in him.”

block.text: "Bai mi wet tasol long God i ken mekim ol samting em i bin tok long mekim,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: na

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, here I am with the children whom God has given me.”

block.text: "Lukim. Mi stap wantaim ol dispela pikinini God i bin givim long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood, he also himself in the same way partook of the same, that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death, that is, the devil.

block.text: Ol dispela pikinini Jisas i tok long en, em ol manmeri tasol. Olsem na Jisas tu i kamap man wankain olsem ol, bai em i ken i dai, na long dispela pasin em i ken bagarapim Satan, em dispela man i gat strong bilong mekim ol manmeri i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People were like slaves all their lives because they were afraid of death. In dying, Jesus freed them.

block.text: Ol manmeri ol i save pret long dai, na olgeta taim ol i stap long graun, dispela pret bilong ol i mekim ol i stap olsem ol kalabus bilong Satan. Tasol Jisas em i dai bilong lusim ol long dispela kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly, he doesn’t give help to angels, but he gives help to the seed of Abraham.

block.text: Tru tumas, Jisas i no bin mekim dispela wok bilong helpim ol ensel. Nogat. Em i mekim wok bilong helpim ol lain tumbuna bilong Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people.

block.text: Olsem na long olgeta samting em i mas kamap wankain tru olsem ol brata bilong en, na em bai inap i stap hetpris bilong ol na mekim wok bilong God. Em i kamap hetpris bilong sori long ol manmeri, na em I save bihainim olgeta tok bilong God na mekim wok bilong em, em wok bilong lusim sin bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in that he himself has suffered being tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.

block.text: Ol traim i bin kamap long em na em yet I bin karim pen. Olsem na em inap long helpim ol manmeri long taim ol traim i kamap long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 3
Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus.

block.text: Ol Kristen brata, God i stap long heven em i bin singautim yupela tu. Yupela i mas tingting gut long Jisas, dispela Aposel na Hetpris yumi save bilip long em na tokaut long nem bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus was faithful to him who appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house.

block.text: God i bin givim dispela wok long em, na em i bihainim tru tok bilong God, long wankain pasin olsem bipo Moses i bin mekim namel long ol lain manmeri i stap olsem haus bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who built the house has more honor than the house.

block.text: Tasol yumi save, biknem bilong man i wokim haus em i winim tru biknem bilong haus yet. Olsem na God i givim Jisas biknem i winim tru biknem bilong Moses.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.

block.text: Olgeta wan wan haus i gat man i bin wokim em. Tasol God i bin wokim olgeta samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken.

block.text: Moses em i stap olsem wokman bilong God, na em i bihainim tru tok bilong God na mekim wok long haus bilong God. Em i gat wok bilong tokaut long ol samting bihain God bai i autim tok long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Christ is faithful as a Son over his house; whose house we are, if we hold fast our confidence and the glorying of our hope firm to the end.

block.text: Tasol Krais em i Pikinini Bilong God, na em i gat wok bilong bosim ol manmeri i stap olsem haus bilong God. Na em i bihainim tru tok bilong God na i mekim dispela wok. Na sapos oltaim yumi bilip strong na yumi amamas na wetim Bikpela i mekim gut long yumi, orait yumi tu i stap olsem haus bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, even as the Holy Spirit says,

block.text: Yumi stap lain manmeri bilong God, olsem na yumi mas harim tok bilong Holi Spirit. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice,
don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness.

block.text: "Nau sapos yupela i harim maus bilong mi God,
orait yupela i no ken pasim strong bel bilong yupela, olsem bipo ol tumbuna bilong yupela i mekim long taim ol i bikhet na sakim tok bilong mi. Ol i stap long ples drai na ol i traim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Your fathers tested me by proving me, and saw my works for forty years.

block.text: Na bihain ol i lukim olgeta strongpela wok mi mekim inap long 40 yia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I was displeased with that generation, and said, ‘They always err in their heart, but they didn’t know my ways.’

block.text: Olsem na mi belhat tru long dispela lain manmeri, na mi tok, 'Bel bilong ol i no save bihainim mi. Olgeta taim ol i save lusim rot mi makim bilong ol.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I swore in my wrath, ‘They will not enter into my rest.’”

block.text: Olsem na mi belhat na mi tokim ol olsem, 'Tru antap, yupela i no inap i go insait long ples malolo bilong mi.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware, brothers, lest perhaps there be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God.

block.text: Ol brata, yupela i mas was gut. Nogut wanpela brata namel long yupela em i gat tingting nogut long bel bilong en na em i lusim bilip na i givim baksait long God i gat laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called “today”; lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

block.text: Olgeta de yumi save kolim "Nau" tasol. Olsem na long olgeta de yupela wan wan i mas givim gutpela tok long ol arapela manmeri bilong God, na kirapim tingting bilong ol, nogut pasin bilong sin i giamanim wanpela bilong yupela na em i pasim strong bel bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end:
while it is said,

block.text: Taim yumi stat long bilip long God, yumi bilip strong tru. Na yumi mas mekim bilip bilong yumi i stap strong tru i go inap long taim bilong yumi dai. Sapos yumi mekim olsem, orait yumi stap ol poroman tru bilong Krais.
Yumi save, dispela tok i stap yet,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.”

block.text: "Nau sapos yupela i harim maus bilong mi God, orait yupela i no ken pasim strong bel bilong yupela, olsem bipo ol tumbuna bilong yupela i mekim long taim ol i bikhet na sakim tok bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For who, when they heard, rebelled? No, didn’t all those who came out of Egypt by Moses?

block.text: Husat ol dispela lain bipo ol i harim maus bilong God, na ol i bikhet na sakim tok bilong em? Em olgeta manmeri Moses i bringim ol i go lusim Isip. Ol tasol i mekim dispela pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn’t it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?

block.text: Na God i belhat long husat inap long 40 yia? Em i belhat long ol dispela manmeri i mekim sin, na ol i dai, na bodi bilong ol i stap long hap i no gat man. Em i belhat long ol dispela lain tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To whom did he swear that they wouldn’t enter into his rest, but to those who were disobedient?

block.text: God i tingting long wanem ol lain na em i tok tru antap ol bai i no inap i go insait long ples malolo bilong en? Em dispela ol manmeri i bin sakim tok bilong em. Em i tok long ol tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief.

block.text: Olsem na yumi save, ol dispela manmeri i no bilip long God, na long dispela as tasol ol i no inap i go insait long dispela ples malolo God i laik bringim ol i go long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 4
Let us fear therefore, lest perhaps anyone of you should seem to have come short of a promise of entering into his rest.

block.text: God i bin promis long bringim yumi tu i go insait long ples bilong malolo. Olsem na yumi mas pret, nogut God i lukim wanpela man bilong yupela em i no inap i go insait long dispela ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For indeed we have had good news preached to us, even as they also did, but the word they heard didn’t profit them, because it wasn’t mixed with faith by those who heard.

block.text: Yumi bin harim gutnius, olsem bipo ol Israel i harim. Tasol ol i harim nating, na ol i no bilip long tok bilong God. Olsem na dispela gutnius ol i harim, em i no helpim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said,

block.text: Tasol yumi manmeri i bilip long God, em bai i larim yumi i go insait long ples malolo bilong en. Bipo God i ting long dispela ples na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest”

block.text: "Olsem na mi belhat na mi tokim ol olsem, 'Tru antap, yupela i no inap i go insait long ples malolo bilong mi.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

block.text: Tru, dispela tok i tok long samting i bin kamap long taim bilong Moses, tasol yumi save, bipo tru, taim God i mekim graun i kamap, em i pinisim olgeta wok bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day,

block.text: Long wanpela hap tok bilong buk bilong God, em i bin tok olsem long de namba 7,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God rested on the seventh day from all his works”

block.text: "Long de namba 7 God i lukim olgeta wok bilong en i pinis, na em i malolo long dispela de."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and in this place again,

block.text: Na long dispela hap tok yumi lukim pastaim em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They will not enter into my rest.”

block.text: "Ol i no inap i go insait long ples malolo bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who received the good news first did not obey. So they do not enter God’s rest. Others may therefore still enter.

block.text: Dispela i soim yumi olsem, dispela ples malolo bilong God i stap yet, na sampela manmeri bai inap i go insait long en. Ol dispela lain bipo ol i harim gutnius, ol i sakim tok bilong en, na ol i no i go insait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God again defines a certain day, today, saying through David so long a time afterward (just as has been said),

block.text: Tasol bihain long taim bilong ol dispela lain, planti yia i go pinis na God i autim tok long maus bilong Devit, olsem yumi tok pinis,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts.”

block.text: "Nau sapos yupela i harim maus bilong mi God, orait yupela i no ken pasim strong bel bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day.

block.text: Sapos bipo Josua i bin givim malolo long ol, orait bihain God bai i no inap tok long narapela de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God.

block.text: Olsem na yumi save, ol manmeri bilong God bai i gat malolo i stap yet, em i olsem malolo bilong de Sabat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he who has entered into his rest has himself also rested from his works, as God did from his.

block.text: Na yumi save, man i go insait long ples malolo bilong God, em i pinisim wok bilong en na i malolo, olsem bipo God i pinisim wok bilong em yet na i malolo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall after the same example of disobedience.

block.text: Orait yumi mas wok strong bilong i go insait long dispela ples malolo. Nogut wanpela man i bihainim dispela pasin bilong sakim tok, olsem bipo ol i mekim, na em bai i pundaun na i lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the word of God is living, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword. It pierces even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and is able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart.

block.text: Tok bilong God em i gat laip, na em i wok strong i stap. Em i sap moa, na i winim bainat i gat tupela sap. Dispela tok i save sutim man na i go insait tru. Em i go kamap stret long dispela hap tewel na spirit i bruk, na long ol dispela hap skru na kru bilong bun i pas wantaim. Olsem na em i save gut tru long olgeta tingting na laik bilong bel bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is no creature that is hidden from his sight, but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

block.text: I no gat wanpela samting God i bin wokim, em inap hait long pes bilong God. Nogat tru. Olgeta samting i op olgeta na i stap ples klia tru long ai bilong God. Na God tasol bai i skelim olgeta pasin yumi mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having then a great high priest, who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold tightly to our confession.

block.text: Orait yumi gat bikpela hetpris i stap, na em i go insait tru long heven. Em Jisas, Pikinini Bilong God. Olsem na yumi mas holimpas dispela bilip yumi save tokaut long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we don’t have a high priest who can’t be touched with the feeling of our infirmities. But one who has been in all points tempted like we are, yet without sin.

block.text: Yumi yet i no gat strong bilong daunim sin. Tasol yumi no ken ting, dispela hetpris bilong yumi em i no inap sori long yumi. Nogat. Olgeta traim i save kamap long yumi, dispela olgeta i bin kamap pinis long em bilong traim em tu. Tasol em i no mekim sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace. So that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need.

block.text: Olsem na yumi ken i go klostu long God, na yumi no ken pret. Em i man bilong marimari. Yumi go long em, na bai yumi lukim em i sori long yumi. Na sapos yumi gat hevi, orait marimari bilong em bai i helpim yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 5
For every high priest, being taken from among men, is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.

block.text: Pasin bilong makim olgeta hetpris em i olsem. God i save kisim wanpela man na em i save putim dispela man long mekim wok bilong em olsem helpim bilong ol manmeri. Hetpris i gat wok bilong givim ol kain kain presen long God na bilong mekim ol kain kain ofa bilong tekewe sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest can deal gently with those who are ignorant and going astray, because he himself is also surrounded with weakness.

block.text: Em yet i no gat strong na em i no inap long mekim planti samting. Olsem na em inap isi long ol man i no gat save na long ol man i bin lusim rot bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself.

block.text: Na em i mas mekim ol ofa bilong tekewe sin bilong ol manmeri na bilong em yet wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nobody takes this honor on himself, but he is called by God, just like Aaron was.

block.text: Man i kamap hetpris, em i gat biknem, na i no gat wanpela man i save kisim dispela wok long laik bilong em yet. Nogat. God i save singautim em pastaim na em i kisim dispela wok, olsem bipo God i bin singautim Aron.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So also Christ didn’t glorify himself to be made a high priest, but it was he who said to him,

block.text: Na Krais tu i olsem. Em i no litimapim nem bilong em yet na i kamap hetpris. Nogat. God yet i makim em bilong mekim dispela wok. God i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my Son. Today I have become your father.”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini bilong mi. Nau mi kamap papa bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he says also in another place,

block.text: Na long narapela hap tu God i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are a priest forever, after the order of Melchizedek.”

block.text: "Bai yu stap pris oltaim oltaim. Yu wankain pris olsem Melkisedek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, in the days of his flesh, offered up prayers and petitions with strong crying and tears. He prayed to him who was able to save him from death, and God heard him because Christ honored God.

block.text: Taim Jisas i stap man long graun, em i save mekim prea na beten long God. Em i save, God inap long kisim bek em, na em i no mas i dai, olsem na em i beten strong long God, na em i singaut strong na i krai planti. Em i save daunim laik bilong em yet na i aninit long God, olsem na God i harim beten bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Though he was God’s Son, yet he learned obedience by the things which he suffered.

block.text: Jisas em i Pikinini Bilong God, tasol em i karim pen, na dispela i skulim em tru long pasin bilong bihainim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having been made perfect, he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation,

block.text: Dispela i mekim em i kamap nambawan man tru bilong bihainim tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: named by God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.

block.text: Olsem na God i makim em na i tok, "Yu stap hetpris, wankain olsem Melkisedek," na em i kamap Man bilong helpim na kisim bek olgeta manmeri i bihainim tok bilong em, bai ol i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About him we have many words to say, and hard to interpret, seeing you have become dull of hearing.

block.text: Planti tok i stap yet bilong Jisas i kamap hetpris olsem Melkisedek, na mipela i laik tokim yupela long en. Tasol tingting bilong yupela i pas na i no klia. Olsem na mipela i painim hat tru long soim yupela as bilong dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For although by this time you should be teachers, you again need to have someone teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God. You have come to need milk, and not solid food.

block.text: Yupela i kamap Kristen longpela taim pinis, na inap yupela i wok long skulim ol arapela long ol tok bilong God. Tasol nogat. Yupela i sot long tingting, na ol arapela man i mas skulim yupela gen long ol namba wan hap tru bilong tok bilong God. Yupela i no redi yet long kisim strongpela kaikai. Nogat. Yupela i dring susu i stap yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who lives on milk is not experienced in the word of righteousness, for he is a baby.

block.text: Yumi save, ol dispela lain i save dring susu tasol, em ol liklik pikinini. Na ol i no save gut long wanem ol pasin i stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But solid food is for those who are full grown, who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil.

block.text: Tasol strongpela kaikai em i bilong ol man i kamap bikpela pinis. Ol kain man olsem ol i bin traim planti taim long skelim wanem ol pasin i gutpela na wanem ol pasin i nogut, na nau ol i save gut pinis na tingting bilong ol i klia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 6
Therefore leaving the teaching of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfection-- Let us not lay again the foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,

block.text: Therefore leaving the teaching of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfection-- l Let us not lay again the foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,

ReferenceBlocks.text: of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

block.text: of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This will we do, if God permits.

block.text: This will we do, if God permits.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the case of those who have fallen back into their former lives: they were illuminated by the light of God. They tasted the gift from heaven and they received the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Consider the case of those who have fallen back into their former lives: they were illuminated by the light of God. They tasted the gift from heaven and they received the Holy Spirit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They loved the beautiful word of God, they felt the powerful forces of the world to come.

block.text: They loved the beautiful word of God, they felt the powerful forces of the world to come.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And yet they have fallen back into their old life. It is impossible for these people to be brought back to repentance. They have nailed the Son of God on the cross again, and have subjected him to public disgrace.

block.text: And yet they have fallen back into their old life. It is impossible for these people to be brought back to repentance. They have nailed the Son of God on the cross again, and have subjected him to public disgrace.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it, and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God.

block.text: Planti taim ren i save kam daun, na graun i save kisim dispela ren. Na sapos dispela graun i karim gutpela kaikai bilong helpim ol manmeri i bin planim gaden long en, orait God bai i mekim gut long dispela graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if it bears thorns and thistles, it is rejected and in danger of being cursed. In the end, it will be burned.

block.text: Tasol sapos graun i karim ol rop i gat nil na ol gras nogut tasol, orait em i graun nogut. I no longtaim na bai God i tok long em i mas bagarap. Na paia bai i kukim em olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this.

block.text: Ol pren tru, nau mipela i mekim dispela strongpela tok long yupela. Tasol mipela i save, yupela bai i no kisim dispela kain bagarap. Nogat. God bai i helpim yupela na kisim bek yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name. You served the saints, and still do serve them.

block.text: God em i no man nogut, na bai em i lusim tingting long ol gutpela wok yupela i bin mekim. Nogat. Yupela i bin givim bel bilong yupela long God, na dispela i bin kirapim yupela long helpim ol manmeri bilong em. Na yupela i save mekim olsem yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end.

block.text: Na mipela i laikim tumas bai yupela olgeta i mas wok strong olsem tasol, na holimpas bilip bilong yupela, na wetim dispela taim God i makim bilong mekim gut long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We do not want you to be sluggish, but rather, imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises.

block.text: Yupela i no ken les. Yupela i mas bihainim pasin bilong ol man i bilip tru na i no les kwik, na ol i kisim olgeta samting bipo God i tok long givim long ol pikinini bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he swore by himself,
saying,

block.text: Bipo God i laik givim promis long Abraham. Na i no gat wanpela man em i bikpela na i winim God, inap long God i ken tok tru antap long nem bilong em. Olsem na God i tok tru antap long nem bilong em yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Surely I will bless you and I will multiply you.”

block.text: "Mi tok tru tumas, bai mi mekim gut tru long yu na bai mi mekim ol lain tumbuna pikinini bilong yu i kamap planti tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

block.text: Na Abraham i wet na em i no les kwik, na bihain em i kisim olgeta samting God i bin promis long givim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For men indeed swear by a greater one, and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.

block.text: Pasin bilong tok tru antap em i olsem. Sapos ol man i tok tru antap long nem bilong wanpela man, dispela i soim olsem dispela man em i bikman tru na i winim ol. Na sapos wanpela man i tok tru antap, dispela i strongim tok bilong em na i pasim maus bilong ol arapela man i laik daunim tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In this way God, being determined to show more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath;

block.text: Bipo God i mekim promis long em bai i mekim gut tru long yumi ol lain bilong Abraham. Na em i laik soim yumi klia tru olsem, em i no inap senisim tingting bilong em, olsem na em i tok tru antap bilong strongim tok bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement. We have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.

block.text: Olsem na nau i gat tupela tok i stap, em promis bilong God na dispela tok tru antap em i bin mekim. Tupela i no inap senis, na long dispela tupela tok God i no inap tru long giaman. Olsem na yumi ol manmeri i bin ranawe i go hait klostu long God, yumi ken tingim dispela promis bilong God na yumi ken strongim tru bel bilong yumi long wet long kisim ol dispela samting God i promis long givim long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into that which is within the veil.

block.text: Samting God i tokim yumi long wetim, dispela i stap olsem gutpela strongpela anka bilong laip bilong yumi. Dispela anka i go insait olgeta long Rum Tambu Tru, baksait long bikpela laplap ol i bin hangamapim long tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus has already entered for us, having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.

block.text: Jisas i go paslain long yumi insait long dispela rum, bilong helpim yumi, long wanem, em i kamap hetpris wankain olsem Melkisedek, na em bai i stap hetpris oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 7
For this Melchizedek was king of Salem, priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him.

block.text: Dispela Melkisedek em i king bilong Salem, na em i pris bilong God Antap Tru. Taim Abraham i pait na i kilim ol king na i wokabaut i go bek long ples, Melkisedek i bungim em long rot na i givim blesing long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham divided and gave to Melchizedek a tenth part of all (being first, by interpretation, king of righteousness, and then also king of Salem, which is king of peace.

block.text: Na Abraham i tilim olgeta samting em i kisim long pait long 10 -pela hap na i givim wanpela hap long Melkisedek. Yumi tanim dispela nem Melkisedek olsem, King Bilong Stretpela Pasin. Na em i king bilong Salem tu, em yumi tanim olsem, King Bilong Pasin Bilong Bel Isi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Melchizedek was without father, without mother, and without a genealogy. He has neither beginning of days nor end of life. Like the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.

block.text: Melkisedek i no gat papa na mama, na em i no gat ol lain tumbuna bilong en. Em i no gat de bilong mama i karim em, na i no gat de bilong em i dai. Em i stap wankain olsem Pikinini Bilong God. Em i stap pris oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now consider how great this man was, to whom even Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the best spoils.

block.text: Yupela i mas tingim dispela Melkisedek, em i gat biknem tru. Namba wan tumbuna bilong yumi, Abraham, em i kisim olgeta gutpela gutpela samting em i bin kisim long pait, na em i tilim long 10 -pela hap na givim wanpela hap long Melkisedek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest’s office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law. That is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham.

block.text: Ol lain pikinini bilong Livai i save kisim wok pris. Na lo i tok olsem, ol arapela Israel i mas tilim ol samting bilong ol long 10 -pela hap na givim wanpela hap long ol Livai. Ol Israel ol i brata bilong ol Livai, na ol tu i pikinini bilong Abraham. Tasol ol Israel i save kisim wanpela hap bilong ol samting bilong ol na givim long ol dispela brata bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Melchizedek, whose genealogy is not counted from them, has accepted tithes from Abraham and has blessed him who has the promises.

block.text: Melkisedek em i no kamap long lain bilong ol Livai. Tasol em i kisim wanpela hap bilong ol samting bilong Abraham. Na Melkisedek i givim blesing long dispela man, promis bilong God i stap long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But without any dispute the lesser is blessed by the greater.

block.text: Yumi save gut olsem, man i givim blesing em i bikman. Na man i kisim blesing long em, em i stap aninit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here people who die receive tithes, but there one receives tithes of whom it is testified that he lives.

block.text: Ol Livai i save kisim wanpela hap bilong ol samting bilong ol Israel, ol i man bilong i dai tasol. Tasol Melkisedek, dispela man i kisim wanpela hap bilong ol samting bilong Abraham, buk bilong God i no gat tok long em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We can say that through Abraham even Levi, who receives tithes, has paid tithes.

block.text: Yumi inap tok olsem Livai, em tumbuna bilong ol lain Livai, em yet i givim ol samting long Melkisedek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We can say this because he was yet in the body of his father when Melchizedek met him.

block.text: Tru, em i no kamap yet long taim Melkisedek i bungim Abraham long rot, tasol em i stap long bodi bilong tumbuna bilong en, Abraham, long taim Abraham i givim ol dispela samting long Melkisedek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now if there were perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people have received the law), what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

block.text: Bipo ol manmeri bilong Israel i kisim lo, na dispela lo i tok, ol Livai i mas mekim wok pris. Tasol sapos wok pris bilong ol Livai em inap mekim ol manmeri i kamap gutpela tru, orait bilong wanem God i tok long narapela pris i mas kamap bihain, em i wankain olsem Melkisedek, na i no wankain olsem Aron?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the priesthood being changed, there is of necessity a change made also in the law.

block.text: Na sapos lain bilong ol pris i senis, orait lo tu i mas senis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe, from which no one has officiated at the altar.

block.text: Dispela man God i bin tok long em bai i stap pris oltaim oltaim, em i bilong narapela lain, na long lain bilong en i no gat wanpela man bipo i bin mekim wok long alta olsem pris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is evident that our Lord has sprung out of Judah, about which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.

block.text: Yumi save pinis, Bikpela bilong yumi em i kamap long lain bilong Juda. Na Moses i no bin mekim wanpela tok long ol man bilong dispela lain bai i stap pris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here is why things are even clearer: another priest came, and he looks like Melchizedek.

block.text: Orait yumi lukim dispela nupela pris i kamap em i wankain olsem Melkisedek, na bai yumi save gut olsem, em i winim tru ol pris bilong lain Livai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is not a priest according to a rule and according to human commandments. He became a priest by the power of a life that can not end.

block.text: Ol Livai i save kamap pris, long wanem, lo i tok, ol man bilong dispela lain i mas kamap pris. Tasol strong bilong laip i stap oltaim oltaim i mekim, na Jisas i kamap pris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is true, the Holy Scriptures say:

block.text: God i tok long em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”

block.text: "Bai yu stap pris oltaim oltaim. Yu wankain pris olsem Melkisedek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: God put aside the previous law of Moses because it was weak and useless.

block.text: Dispela tok i soim yumi olsem, God i rausim pinis lo bilong bipo, long wanem dispela lo i no gat strong na i no inap helpim yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in of a better hope, through which we draw near to God.

block.text: Lo i no bin mekim wanpela samting i kamap gutpela tru. Olsem na God i opim pinis narapela rot i gutpela tru na i winim lo, na long dispela rot yumi ken i go klostu long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Inasmuch as he was not made priest without the taking of an oath.

block.text: Na tu, taim God i makim Jisas i kamap pris, em i no makim em nating. Nogat. Em i tok tru antap na i makim em. Ol pris bilong bipo ol i no olsem. I no gat wanpela man i tok tru antap pastaim na ol i kamap pris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (They indeed have been made priests without an oath), but he with an oath by him that says of him,

block.text: Tasol God yet i tok tru antap, na Jisas i kamap pris. Buk bilong God i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord swore and will not change his mind, ‘You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.’”

block.text: "Bikpela i tok tru antap pinis, 'Bai yu stap pris oltaim oltaim,' na em i no inap senisim tok bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: By so much, Jesus has become the collateral of a better covenant.

block.text: Olsem na yumi save, dispela kontrak Jisas i mekim, em i gutpela moa na i winim kontrak bilong bipo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many, indeed, have been made priests, because they are hindered from continuing by death.

block.text: Bipo planti man i save kamap pris, long wanem, ol i save dai na ol i no inap i stap pris oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable.

block.text: Tasol Jisas i stap oltaim oltaim. Em i holim wok pris oltaim, na i no gat senis bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he is also able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him, seeing that he lives forever to make intercession for them.

block.text: Olsem na oltaim em inap tru long kisim bek ol manmeri i kam klostu long God long nem bilong em, long wanem, em i stap laip oltaim, na em i save beten long God long helpim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For such a high priest was fitting for us: holy, guiltless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

block.text: Dispela kain hetpris em inap tru long helpim yumi. Em i save bihainim ol pasin God i laikim, na i no gat wanpela rong i stap long em. Em i klin olgeta long ai bilong God. Na God i putim em i stap antap tru long heven, longwe tru long ol man bilong mekim sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: who doesn’t need, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices daily, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. For he did this once for all, when he offered up himself.

block.text: Ol hetpris bilong bipo ol i gat wok bilong mekim ofa long olgeta de. Pastaim ol i save mekim ofa bilong tekewe sin bilong ol yet. Na bihain gen ol i mekim ofa bilong tekewe sin bilong ol manmeri. Tasol Jisas i no gat wok olsem. Nogat. Em i mekim ofa wanpela taim tasol. Em i givim laip bilong em yet long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the word of the oath which came after the law appoints a Son forever who has been perfected.

block.text: Lo i save makim ol man i no gat strong, na ol i kamap hetpris. Tasol dispela tok tru antap i kamap bihain long lo, em i makim Pikinini Bilong God. Dispela hetpris em i gutpela man tru na em i kamap nambawan man tru bilong helpim yumi. Na em bai i stap olsem oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 8
Now in the things which we are saying, the main point is this. We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.

block.text: Orait as bilong dispela tok yumi mekim, em i olsem. Yumi gat dispela kain gutpela hetpris i stap, na em i sindaun pinis long han sut bilong sia bilong Namba Wan King long heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is a servant of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man.

block.text: Em i mekim wok pris long haus bilong God long heven, em haus tru bilong God. Dispela haus ol man i no bin sanapim. Nogat. Bikpela yet i bin sanapim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this high priest also have something to offer.

block.text: Olgeta hetpris i gat wok bilong bringim ol presen i kam long God na bilong mekim ol ofa long em. Olsem na Hetpris Jisas tu i mas mekim ofa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, seeing there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law.

block.text: Sapos em i stap long graun, em bai i no inap i stap pris. Long wanem, i gat ol pris i stap pinis, na ol i save givim ol kain kain presen long God, olsem lo i tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, for he said,

block.text: Ol i holim wok pris long dispela haus lotu i stap long graun. Dispela haus lotu em i olsem piksa na tewel tasol bilong haus lotu tru i stap long heven. Em i olsem God i tokim Moses, taim Moses i laik sanapim haus lotu sel. God i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.”

block.text: "Taim yu wokim olgeta samting bilong haus sel, yu mas lukaut gut na bihainim stret dispela piksa bilong en mi bin soim yu long maunten."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now he has obtained a more excellent ministry, by so much as he is also the mediator of a better covenant. A better covenant which on better promises has been given as law.

block.text: Tasol nau Jisas i kisim wok pris, na dispela wok i winim tru wok bilong ol arapela pris. Long wanem, em i stap namelman bilong strongim nupela kontrak, na dispela kontrak i winim tru kontrak bilong bipo. Na ol samting dispela nupela kontrak i promis long givim yumi, ol i winim tru ol samting olpela kontrak i bin promis long givim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second.

block.text: Tingim. Sapos namba wan kontrak i gutpela olgeta, orait God bai i no inap mekim nupela kontrak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For finding fault with them, he said,

block.text: Tasol God i kamapim rong bilong ol manmeri na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the days come,” says the Lord, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.

block.text: "Bikpela i tok, 'Harim. Mi makim pinis wanpela taim na bai mi mekim nupela kontrak wantaim ol lain bilong Israel na ol lain bilong Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will not be according to the covenant that I made with their fathers, in the day that I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; for they didn’t continue in my covenant, and I disregarded them,” says the Lord.

block.text: Dispela kontrak bai i no wankain olsem kontrak bipo mi bin mekim wantaim ol tumbuna bilong ol long taim mi kisim ol long Isip na holim han bilong ol na bringim ol i kam. Tasol ol i no bihainim tok bilong kontrak bilong mi, olsem na mi Bikpela, mi givim baksait long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel. After those days,” says the Lord;

block.text: Tasol dispela nupela kontrak mi laik mekim wantaim ol manmeri bilong Israel, em i olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will put my laws into their mind, I will also write them on their heart. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

block.text: Bai mi putim olgeta lo bilong mi long tingting bilong ol, na bai mi raitim tok bilong mi long bel bilong ol. Na bai mi stap God bilong ol, na bai ol i stap lain manmeri bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will not teach every man his fellow citizen, and every man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord.’ All will know me, from their least to their greatest.

block.text: Na long dispela taim bai ol man i no ken skulim ol wantok na ol brata bilong ol na tok olsem, "Yupela i mas save long Bikpela." Olgeta bai i save pinis long mi, maski ol i man nating o ol i gat biknem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness. I will remember their sins and lawless deeds no more.”

block.text: Long wanem, bai mi marimari long ol na lusim sin bilong ol na mi no ken tingim moa.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that he says, “A new covenant,” he has made the first old. But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away.

block.text: Long dispela tok God i tok long nupela kontrak, na long dispela pasin em i soim olsem namba wan kontrak i kamap olpela pinis. Na samting i kamap olpela na i laik pinis, em bai i stap liklik taim tasol, na bai em i lus olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 9
Now indeed even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and an earthly sanctuary.

block.text: Dispela namba wan kontrak i gat ol lo bilong pasin bilong mekim lotu. Na i gat haus lotu i stap long dispela graun,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a tabernacle was prepared. In the first part were the lampstand, the table, and the show bread; which is called the Holy Place.

block.text: em wanpela haus sel ol i bin sanapim. Long namba wan rum bilong en i gat stik lam na tebol wantaim dispela bret i stap long ai bilong God. Dispela rum ol i kolim "Rum Tambu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the second veil was the tabernacle which is called the Holy of Holies.

block.text: Na ol i hangamapim bikpela laplap olsem banis long baksait bilong Rum Tambu, na baksait long dispela laplap i gat narapela rum ol i kolim "Rum Tambu Tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the Holy of Holies was a golden altar of incense, and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold. In this ark was a golden pot holding the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant.

block.text: Alta bilong kukim paura bilong kamapim smok i gat gutpela smel, em ol i bin karamapim long gol, em i stap long dispela rum, wantaim Bokis Kontrak. Ol i bin karamapim olgeta hap bilong dispela bokis long gol tasol, na insait long bokis ol i bin putim sospen gol i gat mana i stap long en, na stik wokabaut bilong Aron, bipo kru i bin kamap long en, na tupela ston God i bin raitim kontrak long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Above the ark were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat, but we cannot discuss these things in detail now.

block.text: Ai bilong dispela bokis em i ples bilong lusim sin bilong ol manmeri. Na piksa bilong tupela ensel i stap antap long bokis na wing bilong tupela i op i stap na i haitim ai bilong bokis. Tupela ensel i makim God i stap long dispela ples. Tasol nau mi no inap kamapim as bilong dispela olgeta samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now these things having been thus prepared, the priests go in continually into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the services.

block.text: Ol i wokim ol samting olsem, orait long olgeta de ol pris i save go insait long namba wan rum bilong haus lotu sel, na ol i mekim wok bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But into the second, the high priest enters alone, once a year, and never without blood which he offers for himself, and for the sins of the people.

block.text: Na hetpris wanpela tasol em i save go insait long namba 2 rum. Em i save go wanpela taim tasol long olgeta yia. Na em i no i go nating. Nogat. Em i save kisim blut na i go insait. Na long dispela blut em i mekim ofa bilong tekewe sin bilong em yet, na bilong tekewe asua bilong ol sin ol manmeri i no tingting gut na ol i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Holy Spirit is indicating this, that the way into the Holy Place wasn’t yet revealed while the first tabernacle was still standing.

block.text: Long dispela pasin Holi Spirit i soim yumi olsem, taim dispela namba wan haus lotu i stap yet, rot bilong yumi go insait long haus bilong God, em i no kamap ples klia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is a symbol of the present age. Where gifts and sacrifices are offered that are incapable, concerning the conscience, of making the worshipper perfect.

block.text: Dispela haus lotu sel em i olsem piksa bilong soim yumi ol samting i mas kamap long dispela taim nau. Long dispela haus lotu sel, ol i save givim ol presen long God na mekim ol ofa long em. Tasol dispela olgeta samting i no inap stretim bel bilong ol man i mekim lotu, bai ol i save olsem ol i no bin mekim rong. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are only (with meats and drinks and various washings) fleshly ordinances, imposed until a time of reformation.

block.text: Ol dispela lo ol i tok long ol samting bilong kaikai na dring na long ol kain kain pasin bilong mekim ol manmeri i kamap klin. Ol i tok long ol samting bilong bodi tasol. God i givim ol dispela lo bilong ol manmeri i ken bihainim i go inap long taim em i stretim olgeta samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Christ came as a high priest of the good things God promised. He made the way for man to go to God. He was a greater and more perfect tent (Tabernacle). He was not made by human hands and he was not a part of this earth.

block.text: Tasol nau Krais i kam pinis, na em i stap hetpris bilong ol gutpela samting i kamap pinis. Em i go insait pinis long dispela haus lotu sel em i gutpela tru na i winim haus lotu sel bilong bipo. Man i no wokim dispela haus long han, long wanem, em i no samting bilong dispela graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Christ went into the Most Holy Place one time for all people. He did not take the blood of goats and young cows to give to God as a gift in worship. He gave his own blood. Thus he bought us with his own blood and made us free from sin forever.

block.text: Na Krais i no kisim blut bilong meme na bilong pikinini bulmakau na i go insait long dispela haus lotu. Nogat. Em i mekim ofa long blut bilong em yet, na em i go insait long haus lotu wanpela taim tasol. Na em i baim bek yumi bilong oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blood of goats and bulls, and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have been defiled, sanctify them so they are outwardly clean.

block.text: Sapos ol manmeri i kamap doti long ai bilong God, orait ol pris i save kisim blut bilong meme na bilong bulmakau man, wantaim sit bilong paia i kamap long bulmakau meri ol i kukim olgeta long paia, na kapsaitim long ol dispela manmeri. Ol i mekim olsem bilong mekim ol dispela manmeri i kamap klin gen long ai bilong God, na bilong makim ol i stap manmeri bilong God stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How much more then will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

block.text: Tasol blut bilong Krais i winim dispela. Krais i no gat asua bilong wanpela rong i stap long em. Nogat tru. Na long strong bilong Spirit i stap oltaim oltaim, em i givim laip bilong em yet long God olsem ofa. Olsem na blut bilong em i no mekim bodi tasol bilong yumi i kamap klin. Nogat. Em i pinisim asua bilong yumi na yumi save olsem yumi stap klin tru long ai bilong God. Olsem na yumi no mas bihainim moa ol dispela lo i no gat laip, na yumi ken mekim wok bilong God bilong i stap oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason he is the mediator of a new covenant, since a death has occurred for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant. That those who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.

block.text: Blut bilong Jisas i mekim yumi i kamap klin tru long ai bilong God, olsem na Jisas i stap namelman bilong strongim nupela kontrak. Em i dai pinis bilong baim bek ol manmeri na lusim ol sin ol i bin mekim long taim namba wan kontrak i stap yet. Olsem na olgeta manmeri i harim singaut bilong God na i bihainim, ol i ken kisim dispela laip bipo God i tok long givim long ol pikinini bilong en. Na bai ol i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where a last will and testament is, there must of necessity be the death of him who made it.

block.text: Man i ting long bihain em bai i dai, na em i laik tokaut long husat bai i kisim ol samting bilong en, em i save raitim dispela tok long pepa, olsem kontrak. Na sapos pikinini i laik bihainim dispela kontrak na kisim ol samting papa i makim bilong en, orait ol man i mas save gut pastaim olsem, papa i dai pinis, na bai ol i larim pikinini i kisim ol samting bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a will is in force where there has been death, for it is never in force while he who made it lives.

block.text: Sapos dispela man i dai pinis, orait nau tok bilong kontrak i gat strong. Tasol sapos dispela man i mekim kontrak em i stap laip yet, orait kontrak bilong en i stap nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore even the first covenant has not been dedicated without blood.

block.text: Orait long wankain pasin ol i bin kilim abus i dai na kapsaitim blut bilong en bilong strongim namba wan kontrak bilong bipo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of the calves and the goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
saying,

block.text: Pastaim Moses i autim olgeta tok bilong lo long ol manmeri. Na bihain em i kisim blut bilong pikinini bulmakau na bilong meme na tanim wantaim wara. Na em i kisim han bilong diwai hisop ol i bin pasim long retpela string ol i wokim long gras bilong sipsip, na putim long blut. Na em i kamautim na tromoi liklik blut i pas long dispela han bilong diwai i go antap long buk na antap long olgeta manmeri.
Na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the blood of the covenant which God has commanded you.”

block.text: "Dispela em i blut bilong strongim dispela kontrak God i tokim yupela long bihainim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover he sprinkled the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry in the same way with the blood.

block.text: Na long wankain pasin Moses i tromoi blut long haus lotu sel na long olgeta dis samting bilong lotu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: According to the law, nearly everything is cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission.

block.text: Olsem na yumi save, long pasin bilong lo blut tasol i save mekim klostu olgeta samting i kamap klin. Na sapos ol i no kilim wanpela samting i dai na mekim blut bilong en i kapsait, orait God i no save tekewe sin bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

block.text: Ol dispela samting bilong haus lotu sel, ol i piksa tasol bilong ol samting i stap long heven. Na ol i save kisim blut bilong ol abus bilong mekim ol dispela samting i kamap klin long ai bilong God. Tasol bilong mekim ol samting tru i stap long heven i kamap klin, i mas i gat ofa i gutpela tru na i winim ol dispela ofa bilong abus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Christ hasn’t entered into holy places made with hands, which are representations of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us.

block.text: Yumi save, Krais i no bin i go insait long haus lotu ol man i wokim long han na em i piksa tasol bilong haus lotu tru bilong God. Nogat. Em i go insait long heven stret. Na nau em i stap klostu tru long God, na em i wok long helpim yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own.

block.text: Long olgeta yia hetpris i save kisim blut bilong ofa, na em i go insait long Rum Tambu Tru. Na dispela blut em i kisim, em i no blut bilong em yet. Tasol Jisas i no mekim olsem. Em i go long heven bilong givim em yet long God olsem ofa. Na em i no mekim planti taim. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Christ would have had to suffer many times since the foundation of the world. But now once at the end of the ages, he has been revealed to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

block.text: Sapos em i mas mekim planti taim, orait em i mas karim pen planti taim moa, stat long taim God i mekim graun i kamap na i kam inap long nau. Tasol nogat. Nau em i klostu long taim bilong las de, na Krais i kamap long graun wanpela taim tasol, bilong givim em yet long God olsem ofa bilong tekewe ol sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is appointed for all men to die once, and after this, judgment.

block.text: Olgeta man i mas i dai wanpela taim tasol, na bihain ol i mas kamap long kot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is the same with Christ also. He was offered once to bear the sins of many. He will come a second time, without sin, to those who are eagerly waiting for him for salvation.

block.text: Olsem tasol wanpela taim tasol Krais i givim em yet long God olsem ofa, bilong karim hevi bilong ol sin bilong planti manmeri. Na bihain em bai i kamap namba 2 taim, tasol dispela taim em i no kam bilong tekewe sin. Nogat. Em bai i kam bilong kisim bek tru ol man i wetim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 10
For the law, having a shadow of the good to come, not the very image of the things, can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect those who draw near.

block.text: Long lo bilong Moses yumi save lukim piksa o tewel tasol bilong ol gutpela samting i laik kamap bihain. Tasol em i no soim yumi gut tru long ol dispela samting. Lo i tok, ol i mas mekim ol wankain ofa tasol long olgeta yia, olsem na yumi save, lo i no inap stretim tru ol manmeri i kam long haus lotu. Lo i no inap mekim ol i kamap gutpela tru. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else wouldn’t they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?

block.text: Sapos dispela kain ofa inap long mekim ol manmeri i kamap gutpela tru, orait ol i no inap mekim ofa moa. Sapos wanpela ofa tasol inap mekim ol manmeri i kam long haus lotu ol i kamap klin pinis, orait long bel bilong ol, ol bai i no pilim moa olsem ol i gat asua bilong sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in those sacrifices there is a yearly reminder of sins.

block.text: Tasol nogat. Long olgeta yia, ol dispela ofa i save mekim ol i tingting gen long ol sin bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.

block.text: As bilong dispela i olsem. Blut bilong ol bulmakau man na bilong ol meme, em i no inap tru long tekewe sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when he comes into the world, he says,

block.text: Olsem na taim Krais i kam long graun, em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sacrifice and offering you didn’t desire, but you prepared a body for me;

block.text: "Yu no laik bai ol i kilim abus na mekim ofa. Tasol yu bin redim wanpela bodi bilong givim long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You had no pleasure in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin.

block.text: Ol ofa ol i save kukim olgeta long paia, na ol ofa bilong tekewe sin, em tu yu no laikim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come (in the scroll of the book it is written of me) to do your will, O God.’”

block.text: Orait nau mi tok olsem, 'God, mi kam pinis. Olsem bipo ol i raitim tok long mi long buk. Nau mi kam pinis bilong bihainim laik bilong yu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Previously saying,

block.text: Pastaim em i tok long ol ofa lo i tokim ol long mekim. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn’t desire, neither had pleasure in them”

block.text: "Yu no laik bai ol i kilim abus na mekim ofa. Ol ofa ol i save kukim olgeta long paia na ol ofa bilong tekewe sin, em yu no save laikim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: (although the law required them to be made),
then he has said,

block.text: Na bihain em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I have come to do your will.”

block.text: "Mi kam pinis bilong bihainim laik bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He takes away the first, that he may establish the second.

block.text: Olsem na em i rausim dispela pasin bilong bipo, na em i mekim nupela pasin i kisim ples bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By that sacrifice, we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

block.text: Jisas Krais i bihainim laik bilong God, na em i givim bodi bilong em yet olsem ofa wanpela taim tasol. Na long dispela pasin em i mekim yumi i kamap ol lain manmeri bilong God stret na yumi stap holi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every priest indeed stands day by day serving and often offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.

block.text: Olgeta pris ol i save sanap na mekim wok bilong ol long olgeta de. Na ol i save mekim ol dispela wankain ofa planti taim moa, em ol dispela ofa i no inap tru long tekewe sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down on the right hand of God.

block.text: Tasol Krais em i mekim wanpela ofa tasol bilong tekewe sin, na dispela ofa em inap long i stap olgeta taim. Em i mekim olsem pinis, orait em i sindaun long han sut bilong God

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since that time he waits until his enemies are made the footstool of his feet.

block.text: na em i wetim taim bilong God i putim ol birua bilong en i stap aninit long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.

block.text: Ol dispela manmeri em i mekim ol i kamap ol lain manmeri bilong God stret, em i mekim ol i kamap gutpela olgeta long wanpela ofa tasol, na ol bai i stap olsem inap oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,

block.text: Holi Spirit tu i autim tok long yumi olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the covenant that I will make with them:

block.text: "Bikpela i tok olsem, 'Dispela nupela kontrak mi laik mekim wantaim ol, em i olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘After those days,’ says the Lord, ‘I will put my laws on their heart, I will also write them on their mind;’”

block.text: Bai mi putim olgeta lo bilong mi long tingting bilong ol na bai mi raitim tok bilong lo long bel bilong ol.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: then he says,

block.text: Na bihain em i skruim dispela tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more.”

block.text: "Bai mi lusim sin bilong ol na mi no ken tingim moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

block.text: Na sapos God i lusim sin pinis, orait i no gat wok moa long mekim ofa bilong tekewe sin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having therefore, brothers, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus.

block.text: Ol brata, blut bilong Jisas i lusim sin bilong yumi pinis, olsem na yumi inap i go insait long Rum Tambu Tru bilong haus bilong God na yumi no ken pret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We now come to God by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh.

block.text: Yumi ken i go insait long dispela rum long dispela nupela rot i gat laip. Dispela rot Jisas yet i bin opim, em i go insait long dispela bikpela laplap i hangamap i stap olsem dua bilong dispela rum. Dispela laplap em i olsem bodi bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have a great priest over God’s house.

block.text: Yumi gat bikpela hetpris, na em i save lukautim olgeta lain manmeri bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, let’s draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and having our body washed with pure water.

block.text: Em i bin tromoi blut bilong en long bel bilong yumi, bilong pinisim asua bilong ol pasin nogut yumi bin mekim na bilong mekim yumi i save olsem yumi stap klin tru long ai bilong God. Na em i bin wasim bodi bilong yumi long wara i klin tru. Olsem na yumi mas rausim olgeta pasin giaman i stap long bel bilong yumi, na yumi mas bilip tru long God na yumi mas i go klostu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.

block.text: Yumi save tokaut long bilip bilong yumi na long ol gutpela samting yumi wetim i stap. Orait yumi mas holim strong bilip bilong yumi, na yumi no ken pret na surik. Yumi save, olgeta samting God i tok pinis long mekim, tru tumas bai em i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,

block.text: Yumi wan wan i mas tingting tu long ol arapela manmeri bilong God, na painim rot bilong kirapim ol long laikim ol arapela na mekim ol gutpela pasin long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as you see the Day approaching.

block.text: Na yumi ol manmeri bilong God i no ken lusim pasin bilong bung wantaim, olsem sampela man i save mekim. Nogat. Yupela i save, De bilong Krais em i kam klostu. Olsem na yumi wan wan i mas wok strong moa long strongim bel bilong ol arapela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more a sacrifice for sins.

block.text: Harim. Sapos yumi kisim save pinis long tok tru bilong Krais, na bihain, long laik bilong yumi yet yumi wokabaut long pasin bilong sin, orait i no gat narapela ofa moa i stap bilong tekewe dispela sin. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Instead their will be a certain fearful expectation of judgment and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.

block.text: Bai yumi pret nogut tru na wetim de bilong bikpela kot na dispela paia i hat tumas na i redi pinis long kukim ol birua bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A man who disregards Moses’ law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses.

block.text: Yumi save, sapos wanpela man i kalapim lo bilong Moses, na tupela o tripela man i lukim na ol i autim tok long rong em i mekim, orait ol i no ken sori long dispela man. Nogat. Ol i mas kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God? And who has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?

block.text: Orait yupela i ting wanem long man i givim baksait long Pikinini Bilong God? Dispela man bai i kisim bikpela hevi moa yet. Blut bilong Krais i strongim nupela kontrak, em i bin mekim dispela man i kamap man bilong God stret na em i stap holi. Tasol nau dispela man i mekim olsem dispela blut em i samting nating. Na em i mekim pasin nogut tru long Spirit bilong marimari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know him who said,

block.text: Yumi save, God i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Vengeance belongs to me,” says the Lord, “I will repay.”

block.text: "Bekim rong , em i wok bilong mi. Mi yet bai mi bekim rong bilong ol na mekim save long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: Na em I tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord will judge his people.”

block.text: "Bikpela yet bai i skelim pasin bilong ol manmeri bilong en long kot."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

block.text: Sapos God bilong i stap oltaim emi laik mekim save long wanpela man na em i holimpas em, orait dispela man i ken pret nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But remember the former days, in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings.

block.text: Yupela i mas tingim gen dispela taim bipo, taim yupela i kisim lait bilong God. Long dispela taim ol i bin givim ol bikpela hevi long yupela, na yupela i karim planti pen. Tasol yupela i sanap strong na sakim ol dispela hevi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People laughed at you and beat you. When others suffered, you suffered with them.

block.text: Sampela taim ol i bin sanapim yupela long ai bilong ol manmeri, na ol i tok bilas long yupela na mekim nogut long yupela long ai bilong ol. Na sampela taim yupela i bin poroman wantaim ol manmeri i kisim ol dispela kain hevi,na yupela i helpim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you both had compassion on me in my chains. You joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in heaven.

block.text: Na taim ol i putim sampela bilong yupela long kalabus, yupela i bin sori long ol dispela kalabusman na mekim gut long ol. Na taim ol man i bin pulim ol samting bilong yupela, yupela i amamas i stap na larim ol, long wanem, yupela i save olsem, samting tru bilong yupela i stap yet, na dispela bai i stap oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t throw away your boldness, which has a great reward.

block.text: Yupela i mas tingim ol gutpela pasin yupela i save mekim bipo na yupela i no ken lusim dispela strongpela bilip bilong yupela. Nogat. Yupela i mas bilip strong, na bai yupela i kisim bikpela pe tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.
Because,

block.text: Yupela i mas sanap strong, olsem bai yupela i ken bihainim laik bilong God. Na yupela i ken kisim ol gutpela samting, bipo God i promis long givim yupela.
Yes,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In a very little while, he who comes will come, and will not wait.

block.text: "I no longtaim. Liklik taim tasol, na dispela man i laik kam, em bai i kam. Em bai i kam kwik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the righteous will live by faith. If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.”

block.text: Tasol stretpela man bilong mi em i bilip, olsem na em bai i stap laip. Na sapos em i surik, orait bai mi no amamas long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.

block.text: Tasol yumi no man bilong surik na lus. Nogat tru. Yumi ol manmeri bilong bilip na kisim laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 11
Now faith is assurance of things hoped for, proof of things not seen.

block.text: Pasin bilong bilip em i olsem. Yumi save gut tru olsem, olgeta gutpela samting God i promis pinis long givim yumi na yumi wet long kisim, em bai yumi kisim tru. Maski ai bilong yumi i no lukim ol dispela samting, yumi save gut tru olsem, dispela olgeta samting i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by this, the elders obtained testimony.

block.text: Ol man bilong bipo ol i bin bilip, na God i amamas tru long pasin bilong ol na kolim ol i gutpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, we understand that the universe has been framed by the word of God, so that what is seen has not been made out of things which are visible.

block.text: Yumi bilip, olsem na yumi save pinis, God em i mekim skai wantaim graun i kamap long tok bilong em yet. Olsem na olgeta samting yumi inap lukim, em God i wokim long samting yumi no inap lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had testimony given to him that he was righteous, God testifying with respect to his gifts; and through it he, being dead, still speaks.

block.text: Abel i bilip long God, na i mekim ofa long em. Na God i laikim ofa bilong Abel, tasol em i no laikim ofa bilong Kein. Abel i bilip, na long dispela as God i laikim ol presen Abel i givim em. Na dispela i soim yumi olsem God i kolim em stretpela man. Abel i dai pinis, tasol long dispela bilip bilong en i olsem em i autim tok yet long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Enoch was taken away, so that he wouldn’t see death, and he was not found, because God translated him. For he has had testimony given to him that before his translation he had been well pleasing to God.

block.text: Enok i bilip long God, olsem na God i kisim em i go long heven, bai em i no ken i dai. Ol man ol i wok long painim em, tasol ol i no lukim em, long wanem, God i kisim em pinis. Na buk bilong God i tok, taim God i no kisim Enok yet, pasin bilong Enok i gutpela long ai bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him. He who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

block.text: Tasol man i no bilip long God, em i no inap bihainim laik bilong God. Long wanem, man i laik i go klostu long God, em i mas bilip olsem God i stap, na em i mas bilip olsem God i save mekim gut tru long ol man i wok long painim em.
